ACRO_BAL_PITCH.Description: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro and sport mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster. For helicopter sets the decay rate of the virtual flybar in the pitch axis. A higher value causes faster decay of desired to actual attitude.

ACRO_BAL_ROLL.Description: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro and sport mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster. For helicopter sets the decay rate of the virtual flybar in the roll axis. A higher value causes faster decay of desired to actual attitude.

ACRO_OPTIONS.Description: A range of options that can be applied to change acro mode behaviour. Air-mode enables ATC_THR_MIX_MAN at all times (air-mode has no effect on helicopters). Rate Loop Only disables the use of angle stabilization and uses angular rate stabilization only.

ACRO_RP_EXPO.Description: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

ACRO_RP_RATE.Description: Acro mode maximum roll and pitch rate. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation

ACRO_RP_RATE_TC.Description: Acro roll and pitch rate control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response
ACRO_RP_RATE_TC.DisplayName: Acro roll/pitch rate control input time constant

ACRO_TRAINER.Description: Type of trainer used in acro mode

ACRO_Y_EXPO.Description: Acro yaw expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

ACRO_Y_RATE.Description: Acro mode maximum yaw rate. Higher value means faster rate of rotation

ACRO_Y_RATE_TC.Description: Acro yaw rate control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response
ACRO_Y_RATE_TC.DisplayName: Acro yaw rate control input time constant

ADSB_EMIT_TYPE.Description: ADSB classification for the type of vehicle emitting the transponder signal. Default value is 14 (UAV).

ADSB_ICAO_ID.Description: ICAO_ID unique vehicle identification number of this aircraft. This is an integer limited to 24bits. If set to 0 then one will be randomly generated. If set to -1 then static information is not sent, transceiver is assumed pre-programmed.

ADSB_ICAO_SPECL.Description: ICAO_ID of special vehicle that ignores ADSB_LIST_RADIUS and ADSB_LIST_ALT. The vehicle is always tracked. Use 0 to disable.

ADSB_LEN_WIDTH.Description: Aircraft length and width dimension options in Length and Width in meters. In most cases, use a value of 1 for smallest size.

ADSB_LIST_ALT.Description: ADSB vehicle list altitude filter. Vehicles detected above this altitude will be completely ignored. They will not show up in the SRx_ADSB stream to the GCS and will not be considered in any avoidance calculations. A value of 0 will disable this filter.

ADSB_LIST_MAX.Description: ADSB list size of nearest vehicles. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

ADSB_LIST_RADIUS.Description: ADSB vehicle list radius filter. Vehicles detected outside this radius will be completely ignored. They will not show up in the SRx_ADSB stream to the GCS and will not be considered in any avoidance calculations. A value of 0 will disable this filter.

ADSB_LOG.Description: 0: no logging, 1: log only special ID, 2:log all

ADSB_OFFSET_LAT.Description: GPS antenna lateral offset. This describes the physical location offest from center of the GPS antenna on the aircraft.

ADSB_OFFSET_LON.Description: GPS antenna longitudinal offset. This is usually set to 1, Applied By Sensor

ADSB_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Ping200X Send GPS,1:Squawk 7400 on RC failsafe,2:Squawk 7400 on GCS failsafe,3:Sagetech MXS use External Config
ADSB_OPTIONS.Description: Options for emergency failsafe codes and device capabilities

ADSB_RF_CAPABLE.Description: Describes your hardware RF In/Out capabilities.

ADSB_RF_SELECT.Description: Transceiver RF selection for Rx enable and/or Tx enable. This only effects devices that can Tx and/or Rx. Rx-only devices should override this to always be Rx-only.

ADSB_SQUAWK.Description: VFR squawk (Mode 3/A) code is a pre-programmed default code when the pilot is flying VFR and not in contact with ATC. In the USA, the VFR squawk code is octal 1200 (hex 0x280, decimal 640) and in most parts of Europe the VFR squawk code is octal 7000. If an invalid octal number is set then it will be reset to 1200.

ADSB_TYPE.Description: Type of ADS-B hardware for ADSB-in and ADSB-out configuration and operation. If any type is selected then MAVLink based ADSB-in messages will always be enabled

AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS.Description: This sets margin for error in GPS derived altitude limit. This error margin is only used if the barometer has failed. If the barometer fails then the GPS will be used to enforce the AMSL_LIMIT, but this margin will be subtracted from the AMSL_LIMIT first, to ensure that even with the given amount of GPS altitude error the pressure altitude is not breached. OBC users should set this to comply with their D2 safety case. A value of -1 will mean that barometer failure will lead to immediate termination.
AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS.DisplayName: Error margin for GPS based AMSL limit

AFS_AMSL_LIMIT.Description: This sets the AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude limit. If the pressure altitude determined by QNH exceeds this limit then flight termination will be forced. Note that this limit is in meters, whereas pressure altitude limits are often quoted in feet. A value of zero disables the pressure altitude limit.

AFS_DUAL_LOSS.Description: This enables the dual loss termination part of the AFS system. If this parameter is 1 and both GPS and the ground control station fail simultaneously, this will be considered a "dual loss" and cause termination.
AFS_DUAL_LOSS.DisplayName: Enable dual loss terminate due to failure of both GCS and GPS simultaneously

AFS_ENABLE.Description: This enables the advanced failsafe system. If this is set to zero (disable) then all the other AFS options have no effect

AFS_GEOFENCE.Description: This enables the geofence part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

AFS_HB_PIN.Description: This sets a digital output pin which is cycled at 10Hz when termination is not activated. Note that if a FS_TERM_PIN is set then the heartbeat pin will continue to cycle at 10Hz when termination is activated, to allow the termination board to distinguish between autopilot crash and termination. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.
AFS_HB_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5

AFS_MAN_PIN.Description: This sets a digital output pin to set high when in manual mode. See the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS.Description: Maximum number of comms loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on comms recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of comms loss events.
AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS.DisplayName: Maximum number of comms loss events

AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS.Description: Maximum number of GPS loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on GPS recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of GPS loss events.
AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS.DisplayName: Maximum number of GPS loss events

AFS_MAX_RANGE.Description: This is the maximum range of the vehicle in kilometers from first arming. If the vehicle goes beyond this range then the TERM_ACTION is performed. A value of zero disables this feature.

AFS_QNH_PRESSURE.Description: This sets the QNH pressure in millibars to be used for pressure altitude in the altitude limit. A value of zero disables the altitude limit.

AFS_RC.Description: This enables the RC part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

AFS_RC_FAIL_TIME.Description: This is the time in seconds in manual mode that failsafe termination will activate if RC input is lost. For the OBC rules this should be (1.5). Use 0 to disable.

AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY.Description: If this parameter is set to 1, then an RC loss will only cause the plane to terminate in manual control modes. If it is 0, then the plane will terminate in any flight mode.
AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY.DisplayName: Enable RC Termination only in manual control modes

AFS_TERMINATE.Description: Can be set in flight to force termination of the heartbeat signal

AFS_TERM_ACTION.Description: This can be used to force an action on flight termination. Normally this is handled by an external failsafe board, but you can setup ArduPilot to handle it here. Please consult the wiki for more information on the possible values of the parameter

AFS_TERM_PIN.Description: This sets a digital output pin to set high on flight termination. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.
AFS_TERM_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5

AFS_WP_COMMS.Description: Waypoint number to navigate to on comms loss

AFS_WP_GPS_LOSS.Description: Waypoint number to navigate to on GPS lock loss

AHRS_COMP_BETA.Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.
AHRS_COMP_BETA.DisplayName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient

AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT.Description: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL.Description: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW.Description: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_EKF_TYPE.Description: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_TYPE.DisplayName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS according to its own parameters. A value of 2 means to use GPS for height as well as position - both in DCM estimation and when determining altitude-above-home.
AHRS_GPS_USE.DisplayName: AHRS use GPS for DCM navigation and position-down
AHRS_GPS_USE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:Use GPS for DCM position,2:Use GPS for DCM position and height

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for AHRS orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_ROT1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_ROT2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_MAX_WIND to disable airspeed sensors.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

AIS_LIST_MAX.Description: AIS list size of nearest vessels. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

AIS_LOGGING.Bitmask: 0:Log all AIVDM messages,1:Log only unsupported AIVDM messages,2:Log decoded messages

AIS_TIME_OUT.Description: if no updates are received in this time a vessel will be removed from the list

ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

ARMING_ACCTHRESH.Description: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

ARMING_CHECK.Bitmask: 0:All,1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC Channels,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration,13:System,14:Mission,15:Rangefinder,16:Camera,17:AuxAuth,18:VisualOdometry,19:FFT
ARMING_CHECK.Description: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. For most users it is recommended to leave this at the default of 1 (all checks enabled). You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72.

ARMING_MIS_ITEMS.Description: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

ARMING_OPTIONS.Description: Options that can be applied to change arming behaviour

ARMING_RUDDER.Description: Allow arm/disarm by rudder input. When enabled arming can be done with right rudder, disarming with left rudder. Rudder arming only works in manual throttle modes with throttle at zero +- deadzone (RCx_DZ)

AROT_AS_ACC_MAX.Description: Maximum forward acceleration to apply in speed controller.

AROT_BAIL_TIME.Description: Time in seconds from bail out initiated to the exit of autorotation flight mode.

AROT_COL_FILT_E.Description: Cut-off frequency for collective low pass filter. For the entry phase. Acts as a following trim. Must be higher than AROT_COL_FILT_G.

AROT_COL_FILT_G.Description: Cut-off frequency for collective low pass filter. For the glide phase. Acts as a following trim. Must be lower than AROT_COL_FILT_E.

AROT_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the autonomous autorotation capability.

AROT_FW_V_FF.Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. Corrects the target acceleration proportionally to the desired velocity.

AROT_FW_V_P.Description: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Determines the propotion of the target acceleration based on the velocity error.

AROT_HS_P.Description: Increase value to increase sensitivity of head speed controller during autonomous autorotation.
AROT_HS_P.DisplayName: P gain for head speed controller

AROT_HS_SENSOR.Description: Allocate the RPM sensor instance to use for measuring head speed. RPM1 = 0. RPM2 = 1.

AROT_HS_SET_PT.Description: The target head speed in RPM during autorotation. Start by setting to desired hover speed and tune from there as necessary.

AROT_TARG_SP.Description: Target ground speed in cm/s for the autorotation controller to try and achieve/ maintain during the glide phase.

ARSPD2_AUTOCAL.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
ARSPD2_AUTOCAL.DisplayName: Automatic airspeed ratio calibration for 2nd airspeed sensor

ARSPD2_BUS.Description: The bus number of the I2C bus to look for the sensor on

ARSPD2_DEVID.Description: Airspeed2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ARSPD2_PIN.Description: Pin number indicating location of analog airspeed sensors. Pixhawk/Cube if set to 15.

ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE.Description: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device
ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE.DisplayName: The PSI range of the device for 2nd sensor

ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL.Description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.
ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL.DisplayName: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup for 2nd sensor

ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR.Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.
ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR.DisplayName: Control pitot tube order of 2nd airspeed sensor

ARSPD2_USE.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_AUTOCAL.Description: Enables automatic adjustment of ARSPD_RATIO during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.
ARSPD_AUTOCAL.DisplayName: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_BUS.Description: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected

ARSPD_DEVID.Description: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ARSPD_OPTIONS.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_PIN.Description: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog airspeed port.

ARSPD_PRIMARY.Description: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

ARSPD_PSI_RANGE.Description: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device
ARSPD_PSI_RANGE.DisplayName: The PSI range of the device

ARSPD_RATIO.Description: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

ARSPD_SKIP_CAL.Description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.
ARSPD_SKIP_CAL.DisplayName: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup

ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER.Description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

ARSPD_USE.Description: This parameter is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_WIND_GATE.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle.

ARSPD_WIND_MAX.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
ARSPD_WIND_MAX.DisplayName: Maximum airspeed and ground speed difference

ARSPD_WIND_WARN.Description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
ARSPD_WIND_WARN.DisplayName: Airspeed and ground speed difference that gives a warning

ATC_ANGLE_BOOST.Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.DisplayName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

ATC_ANG_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate
ATC_ANG_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain

ATC_ANG_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate
ATC_ANG_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis angle controller P gain

ATC_ANG_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate
ATC_ANG_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain

ATC_HOVR_ROL_TRM.Description: Trim the hover roll angle to counter tail rotor thrust in a hover

ATC_INPUT_TC.Description: Attitude control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

ATC_RATE_P_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

ATC_RATE_R_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

ATC_RATE_Y_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

ATC_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
ATC_RAT_PIT_ILMI.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output
ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output
ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output
ATC_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output
ATC_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
ATC_RAT_RLL_ILMI.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output
ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output
ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output
ATC_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output
ATC_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
ATC_RAT_YAW_ILMI.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output
ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output
ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output
ATC_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output
ATC_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

ATC_THR_MIX_MAN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MAX.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MIN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

AUTOTUNE_AGGR.Description: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

AUTOTUNE_FRQ_MAX.Description: Defines the end frequency for sweeps and dwells

AUTOTUNE_FRQ_MIN.Description: Defines the start frequency for sweeps and dwells

AUTOTUNE_GN_MAX.Description: Defines the response gain (output/input) to tune

AUTOTUNE_SEQ.Bitmask: 0:VFF,1:Rate D/Rate P(incl max gain),2:Angle P,3:Max Gain Only
AUTOTUNE_SEQ.Description: 2-byte bitmask to select what tuning should be performed. Max gain automatically performed if Rate D is selected. Values: 7:All,1:VFF Only,2:Rate D/Rate P Only(incl max gain),4:Angle P Only,8:Max Gain Only,3:VFF and Rate D/Rate P(incl max gain),5:VFF and Angle P,6:Rate D/Rate P(incl max gain) and angle P

AUTOTUNE_VELXY_P.Description: Velocity xy P gain used to hold position during Max Gain, Rate P, and Rate D frequency sweeps

AUTO_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Allow Arming,1:Allow Takeoff Without Raising Throttle,2:Ignore pilot yaw
AUTO_OPTIONS.Description: A range of options that can be applied to change auto mode behaviour. Allow Arming allows the copter to be armed in Auto. Allow Takeoff Without Raising Throttle allows takeoff without the pilot having to raise the throttle. Ignore pilot yaw overrides the pilot's yaw stick being used while in auto.

AVD_F_ACTION.Description: Specifies aircraft behaviour when a collision is imminent

AVD_F_ALT_MIN.Description: Minimum AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude for ADS-B avoidance. If the vehicle is below this altitude, no avoidance action will take place. Useful to prevent ADS-B avoidance from activating while below the tree line or around structures. Default of 0 is no minimum.

AVD_F_DIST_XY.Description: Closest allowed projected distance before F_ACTION is undertaken

AVD_F_DIST_Z.Description: Closest allowed projected distance before BEHAVIOUR_F is undertaken

AVD_F_RCVRY.Description: Determines what the aircraft will do after a fail event is resolved
AVD_F_RCVRY.DisplayName: Recovery behaviour after a fail event
AVD_F_RCVRY.Values: 0:Remain in AVOID_ADSB,1:Resume previous flight mode,2:RTL,3:Resume if AUTO else Loiter

AVD_F_TIME.Description: Aircraft velocity vectors are multiplied by this time to determine closest approach. If this results in an approach closer than F_DIST_XY or F_DIST_Z then F_ACTION is undertaken

AVD_OBS_MAX.Description: Maximum number of obstacles to track
AVD_OBS_MAX.DisplayName: Maximum number of obstacles to track

AVD_W_ACTION.Description: Specifies aircraft behaviour when a collision may occur

AVD_W_DIST_XY.Description: Closest allowed projected distance before W_ACTION is undertaken

AVD_W_DIST_Z.Description: Closest allowed projected distance before BEHAVIOUR_W is undertaken

AVD_W_TIME.Description: Aircraft velocity vectors are multiplied by this time to determine closest approach. If this results in an approach closer than W_DIST_XY or W_DIST_Z then W_ACTION is undertaken (assuming F_ACTION is not undertaken)

AVOID_ACCEL_MAX.Description: Maximum acceleration with which obstacles will be avoided with. Set zero to disable acceleration limits

AVOID_ALT_MIN.Description: Minimum altitude above which proximity based avoidance will start working. This requires a valid downward facing rangefinder reading to work. Set zero to disable

AVOID_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Max lean angle used to avoid obstacles while in non-GPS modes
AVOID_ANGLE_MAX.DisplayName: Avoidance max lean angle in non-GPS flight modes

AVOID_BACKUP_DZ.Description: Distance beyond AVOID_MARGIN parameter, after which vehicle will backaway from obstacles. Increase this parameter if you see vehicle going back and forth in front of obstacle.
AVOID_BACKUP_DZ.DisplayName: Avoidance deadzone between stopping and backing away from obstacle

AVOID_BACKUP_SPD.Description: Maximum speed that will be used to back away from obstacles in GPS modes (m/s). Set zero to disable

AVOID_DIST_MAX.Description: Distance from object at which obstacle avoidance will begin in non-GPS modes
AVOID_DIST_MAX.DisplayName: Avoidance distance maximum in non-GPS flight modes

AVOID_MARGIN.Description: Vehicle will attempt to stay at least this distance (in meters) from objects while in GPS modes
AVOID_MARGIN.DisplayName: Avoidance distance margin in GPS modes

BARO1_DEVID.Description: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO1_WCF_BCK.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_BCK.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)

BARO1_WCF_ENABLE.Description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

BARO1_WCF_FWD.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_FWD.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)

BARO1_WCF_LFT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_LFT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)

BARO1_WCF_RGT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO1_WCF_RGT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)

BARO2_DEVID.Description: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO2_WCF_BCK.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO2_WCF_BCK.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)

BARO2_WCF_ENABLE.Description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

BARO2_WCF_FWD.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO2_WCF_FWD.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)

BARO2_WCF_LFT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO2_WCF_LFT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)

BARO2_WCF_RGT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO2_WCF_RGT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)

BARO3_DEVID.Description: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO3_WCF_BCK.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO3_WCF_BCK.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)

BARO3_WCF_ENABLE.Description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

BARO3_WCF_FWD.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO3_WCF_FWD.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)

BARO3_WCF_LFT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO3_WCF_LFT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)

BARO3_WCF_RGT.Description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
BARO3_WCF_RGT.DisplayName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)

BARO_ALTERR_MAX.Description: This is the maximum acceptable altitude discrepancy between GPS altitude and barometric presssure altitude calculated against a standard atmosphere for arming checks to pass. If you are getting an arming error due to this parameter then you may have a faulty or substituted barometer. A common issue is vendors replacing a MS5611 in a "Pixhawk" with a MS5607. If you have that issue then please see BARO_OPTIONS parameter to force the MS5611 to be treated as a MS5607. This check is disabled if the value is zero.

BARO_ALT_OFFSET.Description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

BARO_EXT_BUS.Description: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the GND_PROBE_EXT parameter.

BARO_FIELD_ELV.Description: User provided field elevation in meters. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means no correction for takeoff height above sea level is performed.

BARO_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.
BARO_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted

BARO_GND_TEMP.Description: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

BARO_PRIMARY.Description: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

BARO_PROBE_EXT.Description: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on GND_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in GND_EXT_BUS.

BATT2_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT2_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT2_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2__ARM_VOLT parameter.

BATT2_ARM_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

BATT2_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT2_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT2_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT2_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATT2_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

BATT2_FL_FLTR.Description: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

BATT2_FL_PIN.Description: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.
BATT2_FL_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,11:Pixracer,13:Pixhawk ADC4,14:Pixhawk ADC3,15:Pixhawk ADC6/Pixhawk2 ADC,103:Pixhawk SBUS

BATT2_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT2_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe
BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe
BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT2_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT2_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT2_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT2_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current
BATT2_MONITOR.Values: 0:Disabled,3:Analog Voltage Only,4:Analog Voltage and Current,5:Solo,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Generic,8:DroneCAN-BatteryInfo,9:ESC,10:Sum Of Selected Monitors,11:FuelFlow,12:FuelLevelPWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign,16:SMBus-Maxell,17:Generator-Elec,18:Generator-Fuel,19:Rotoye,20:MPPT,21:INA2XX,22:LTC2946,23:Torqeedo,24:FuelLevelAnalog

BATT2_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
BATT2_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATT2_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATT2_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATT2_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATT2_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

BATT2_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

BATT3_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT3_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT3_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT3__ARM_VOLT parameter.

BATT3_ARM_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

BATT3_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT3_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT3__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT3_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT3_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT3_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT3_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATT3_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

BATT3_FL_FLTR.Description: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

BATT3_FL_PIN.Description: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.
BATT3_FL_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,11:Pixracer,13:Pixhawk ADC4,14:Pixhawk ADC3,15:Pixhawk ADC6/Pixhawk2 ADC,103:Pixhawk SBUS

BATT3_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT3_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT3_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe
BATT3_FS_CRT_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT3_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe
BATT3_FS_LOW_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT3_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT3_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT3_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT3_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT3_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT3_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT3_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT3_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current
BATT3_MONITOR.Values: 0:Disabled,3:Analog Voltage Only,4:Analog Voltage and Current,5:Solo,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Generic,8:DroneCAN-BatteryInfo,9:ESC,10:Sum Of Selected Monitors,11:FuelFlow,12:FuelLevelPWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign,16:SMBus-Maxell,17:Generator-Elec,18:Generator-Fuel,19:Rotoye,20:MPPT,21:INA2XX,22:LTC2946,23:Torqeedo,24:FuelLevelAnalog

BATT3_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
BATT3_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATT3_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATT3_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATT3_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATT3_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT3_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

BATT3_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

BATT4_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT4_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT4_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT4__ARM_VOLT parameter.

BATT4_ARM_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

BATT4_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT4_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT4_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT4_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT4_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATT4_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

BATT4_FL_FLTR.Description: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

BATT4_FL_PIN.Description: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.
BATT4_FL_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,11:Pixracer,13:Pixhawk ADC4,14:Pixhawk ADC3,15:Pixhawk ADC6/Pixhawk2 ADC,103:Pixhawk SBUS

BATT4_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT4_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT4_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe
BATT4_FS_CRT_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe
BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT4_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT4_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT4_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT4_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT4_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT4_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT4_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current
BATT4_MONITOR.Values: 0:Disabled,3:Analog Voltage Only,4:Analog Voltage and Current,5:Solo,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Generic,8:DroneCAN-BatteryInfo,9:ESC,10:Sum Of Selected Monitors,11:FuelFlow,12:FuelLevelPWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign,16:SMBus-Maxell,17:Generator-Elec,18:Generator-Fuel,19:Rotoye,20:MPPT,21:INA2XX,22:LTC2946,23:Torqeedo,24:FuelLevelAnalog

BATT8_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT8_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe
BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe
BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT8_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT8_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT8_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT8_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT8_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT8_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current
BATT8_MONITOR.Values: 0:Disabled,3:Analog Voltage Only,4:Analog Voltage and Current,5:Solo,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Generic,8:DroneCAN-BatteryInfo,9:ESC,10:Sum Of Selected Monitors,11:FuelFlow,12:FuelLevelPWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign,16:SMBus-Maxell,17:Generator-Elec,18:Generator-Fuel,19:Rotoye,20:MPPT,21:INA2XX,22:LTC2946,23:Torqeedo,24:FuelLevelAnalog

BATT8_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS
BATT8_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

BATT8_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

BATT8_SUM_MASK.Description: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

BATT8_VLT_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

BATT8_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT8_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

BATT8_VOLT_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

BATT9_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT9_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT9_ARM_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT9__ARM_VOLT parameter.

BATT9_ARM_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

BATT9_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT9_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT9_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT9_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

BATT9_CURR_MULT.Description: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

BATT9_CURR_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

BATT9_FL_FLTR.Description: Filter frequency in Hertz where a low pass filter is used. This is used to filter out tank slosh from the fuel level reading. A value of -1 disables the filter and unfiltered voltage is used to determine the fuel level. The suggested values at in the range of 0.2 Hz to 0.5 Hz.

BATT9_FL_PIN.Description: Analog input pin that fuel level sensor is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.
BATT9_FL_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,11:Pixracer,13:Pixhawk ADC4,14:Pixhawk ADC3,15:Pixhawk ADC6/Pixhawk2 ADC,103:Pixhawk SBUS

BATT9_FL_VLT_MIN.Description: The voltage seen on the analog pin when the fuel tank is empty. Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT9_FL_V_MULT.Description: Voltage multiplier to determine what the full tank voltage reading is. This is calculated as 1 / (Voltage_Full - Voltage_Empty) Note: For this type of battery monitor, the voltage seen by the analog pin is displayed as battery voltage on a GCS.

BATT9_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe
BATT9_FS_CRT_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe
BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT.Values: 0:None,1:Land,2:RTL,3:SmartRTL or RTL,4:SmartRTL or Land,5:Terminate,6:Auto DO_LAND_START or RTL

If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT9_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

BATT9_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current
BATT9_MONITOR.Values: 0:Disabled,3:Analog Voltage Only,4:Analog Voltage and Current,5:Solo,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Generic,8:DroneCAN-BatteryInfo,9:ESC,10:Sum Of Selected Monitors,11:FuelFlow,12:FuelLevelPWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign,16:SMBus-Maxell,17:Generator-Elec,18:Generator-Fuel,19:Rotoye,20:MPPT,21:INA2XX,22:LTC2946,23:Torqeedo,24:FuelLevelAnalog
