INS_TCAL2_ENABLE.Description: Enable the use of temperature calibration parameters for this IMU. For automatic learning set to 2 and also set the INS_TCALn_TMAX to the target temperature, then reboot

INS_TCAL2_GYR1_X.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR1_X.DisplayName: Gyroscope 1st order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL2_GYR1_Y.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR1_Y.DisplayName: Gyroscope 1st order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL2_GYR1_Z.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR1_Z.DisplayName: Gyroscope 1st order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL2_GYR2_X.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR2_X.DisplayName: Gyroscope 2nd order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL2_GYR2_Y.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR2_Y.DisplayName: Gyroscope 2nd order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL2_GYR2_Z.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR2_Z.DisplayName: Gyroscope 2nd order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL2_GYR3_X.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR3_X.DisplayName: Gyroscope 3rd order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL2_GYR3_Y.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR3_Y.DisplayName: Gyroscope 3rd order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL2_GYR3_Z.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL2_GYR3_Z.DisplayName: Gyroscope 3rd order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL2_TMAX.Description: The maximum temperature that the calibration is valid for. This must be at least 10 degrees above TMIN for calibration

INS_TCAL2_TMIN.Description: The minimum temperature that the calibration is valid for

INS_TCAL3_ACC1_X.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC1_X.DisplayName: Accelerometer 1st order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL3_ACC1_Y.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC1_Y.DisplayName: Accelerometer 1st order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL3_ACC1_Z.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC1_Z.DisplayName: Accelerometer 1st order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL3_ACC2_X.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC2_X.DisplayName: Accelerometer 2nd order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL3_ACC2_Y.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC2_Y.DisplayName: Accelerometer 2nd order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL3_ACC2_Z.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC2_Z.DisplayName: Accelerometer 2nd order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL3_ACC3_X.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC3_X.DisplayName: Accelerometer 3rd order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL3_ACC3_Y.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC3_Y.DisplayName: Accelerometer 3rd order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL3_ACC3_Z.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_ACC3_Z.DisplayName: Accelerometer 3rd order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL3_ENABLE.Description: Enable the use of temperature calibration parameters for this IMU. For automatic learning set to 2 and also set the INS_TCALn_TMAX to the target temperature, then reboot

INS_TCAL3_GYR1_X.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR1_X.DisplayName: Gyroscope 1st order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL3_GYR1_Y.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR1_Y.DisplayName: Gyroscope 1st order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL3_GYR1_Z.Description: This is the 1st order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR1_Z.DisplayName: Gyroscope 1st order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL3_GYR2_X.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR2_X.DisplayName: Gyroscope 2nd order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL3_GYR2_Y.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR2_Y.DisplayName: Gyroscope 2nd order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL3_GYR2_Z.Description: This is the 2nd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR2_Z.DisplayName: Gyroscope 2nd order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL3_GYR3_X.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR3_X.DisplayName: Gyroscope 3rd order temperature coefficient X axis

INS_TCAL3_GYR3_Y.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR3_Y.DisplayName: Gyroscope 3rd order temperature coefficient Y axis

INS_TCAL3_GYR3_Z.Description: This is the 3rd order temperature coefficient from a temperature calibration
INS_TCAL3_GYR3_Z.DisplayName: Gyroscope 3rd order temperature coefficient Z axis

INS_TCAL3_TMAX.Description: The maximum temperature that the calibration is valid for. This must be at least 10 degrees above TMIN for calibration

INS_TCAL3_TMIN.Description: The minimum temperature that the calibration is valid for

INS_TCAL_OPTIONS.Description: This enables optional temperature calibration features. Setting PersistParams will save the accelerometer and temperature calibration parameters in the bootloader sector on the next update of the bootloader.

INS_TRIM_OPTION.Description: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims
INS_TRIM_OPTION.Values: 0:Don't adjust the trims,1:Assume first orientation was level,2:Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

INS_USE.Description: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE.DisplayName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE2.Description: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE2.DisplayName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE3.Description: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE3.DisplayName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

LAND_ALT_LOW.Description: Altitude during Landing at which vehicle slows to LAND_SPEED

LAND_REPOSITION.Description: Enables user input during LAND mode, the landing phase of RTL, and auto mode landings.

LAND_SPEED.Description: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

LAND_SPEED_HIGH.Description: The descent speed for the first stage of landing in cm/s. If this is zero then WPNAV_SPEED_DN is used

LGR_DEPLOY_ALT.Description: Altitude where the landing gear will be deployed. This should be lower than the RETRACT_ALT. If zero then altitude is not used for deploying landing gear. Only applies when vehicle is armed.

LGR_DEPLOY_PIN.Description: Pin number to use for detection of gear deployment. If set to -1 feedback is disabled. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

LGR_DEPLOY_POL.Description: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the pin should be high when gear are deployed. If set to 0 then then deployed gear level is low.

LGR_OPTIONS.Description: Options to retract or deploy landing gear in Auto or Guided mode

LGR_RETRACT_ALT.Description: Altitude where the landing gear will be retracted. This should be higher than the DEPLOY_ALT. If zero then altitude is not used for retracting landing gear. Only applies when vehicle is armed.

LGR_WOW_PIN.Description: Pin number to use for feedback of weight on wheels condition. If set to -1 feedback is disabled. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

LGR_WOW_POL.Description: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the pin should be high when there is weight on wheels. If set to 0 then then weight on wheels level is low.
LGR_WOW_POL.DisplayName: Weight on wheels feedback pin polarity

LOG_BACKEND_TYPE.Description: Bitmap of what Logger backend types to enable. Block-based logging is available on SITL and boards with dataflash chips. Multiple backends can be selected.

LOG_BITMASK.Bitmask: 0:Fast Attitude,1:Medium Attitude,2:GPS,3:System Performance,4:Control Tuning,5:Navigation Tuning,6:RC input,7:IMU,8:Mission Commands,9:Battery Monitor,10:RC output,11:Optical Flow,12:PID,13:Compass,15:Camera,17:Motors,18:Fast IMU,19:Raw IMU,20:Video Stabilization,21:Fast harmonic notch logging
LOG_BITMASK.Description: Bitmap of what on-board log types to enable. This value is made up of the sum of each of the log types you want to be saved. It is usually best just to enable all basiclog types by setting this to 65535.

LOG_BLK_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the mavlink backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_BLK_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for block backend

LOG_DISARMED.Description: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled while disarmed. This can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues

LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.Description: The File and Block backends use a buffer to store data before writing to the block device. Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging. This buffer size may be reduced depending on available memory. PixHawk requires at least 4 kilobytes. Maximum value available here is 64 kilobytes.
LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum AP_Logger File and Block Backend buffer size (in kilobytes)

LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.Description: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed. If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened. Applies to the File and Block logging backends.
LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.DisplayName: Stop logging to current file on disarm

LOG_FILE_MB_FREE.Description: Set this such that the free space is larger than your largest typical flight log
LOG_FILE_MB_FREE.DisplayName: Old logs on the SD card will be deleted to maintain this amount of free space

LOG_FILE_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the file backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_FILE_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for file backend

LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.Description: This controls the amount of time before failing writes to a log file cause the file to be closed and logging stopped.
LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: Timeout before giving up on file writes

LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.Description: Maximum amount of memory to allocate to AP_Logger-over-mavlink
LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum AP_Logger MAVLink Backend buffer size

LOG_MAV_RATEMAX.Description: This sets the maximum rate that streaming log messages will be logged to the mavlink backend. A value of zero means that rate limiting is disabled.
LOG_MAV_RATEMAX.DisplayName: Maximum logging rate for mavlink backend

LOG_REPLAY.Description: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 state estimator will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost
LOG_REPLAY.DisplayName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay

LOIT_ACC_MAX.Description: Loiter maximum correction acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values cause the copter to correct position errors more aggressively.

LOIT_ANG_MAX.Description: Loiter maximum pilot requested lean angle. Set to zero for 2/3 of PSC_ANGLE_MAX/ANGLE_MAX. The maximum vehicle lean angle is still limited by PSC_ANGLE_MAX/ANGLE_MAX

LOIT_BRK_ACCEL.Description: Loiter braking acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered.

LOIT_BRK_JERK.Description: Loiter braking jerk in cm/s/s/s. Higher values will remove braking faster if the pilot moves the sticks during a braking maneuver.

LOIT_SPEED.Description: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

MIS_OPTIONS.Description: Bitmask of what options to use in missions.

MIS_RESTART.Description: Controls mission starting point when entering Auto mode (either restart from beginning of mission or resume from last command run)
MIS_RESTART.DisplayName: Mission Restart when entering Auto mode

MIS_TOTAL.Description: The number of mission mission items that has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

MNT1_DEFLT_MODE.Description: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

MNT1_LEAD_PTCH.Description: Servo mount pitch angle output leads the vehicle angle by this amount of time based on current pitch rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but does not overshoot

MNT1_LEAD_RLL.Description: Servo mount roll angle output leads the vehicle angle by this amount of time based on current roll rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but does not overshoot

MNT1_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT1_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT1_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT1_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT1_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT1_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT1_RC_RATE.Description: Pilot rate control's maximum rate. Set to zero to use angle control

MNT1_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT1_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT1_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT1_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT1_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw angle when in retracted position
MNT1_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw angle when in retracted position

MNT2_DEFLT_MODE.Description: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

MNT2_LEAD_PTCH.Description: Servo mount pitch angle output leads the vehicle angle by this amount of time based on current pitch rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but does not overshoot

MNT2_LEAD_RLL.Description: Servo mount roll angle output leads the vehicle angle by this amount of time based on current roll rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but does not overshoot

MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT2_RC_RATE.Description: Pilot rate control's maximum rate. Set to zero to use angle control

MNT2_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw angle when in retracted position

MOT_BAT_CURR_MAX.Description: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

MOT_BAT_CURR_TC.Description: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

MOT_BAT_IDX.Description: Which battery monitor should be used for doing compensation

MOT_BAT_VOLT_MAX.Description: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 4.2 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

MOT_BAT_VOLT_MIN.Description: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 3.3 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

MOT_BOOST_SCALE.Description: Booster motor output scaling factor vs main throttle. The output to the BoostThrottle servo will be the main throttle times this scaling factor. A higher scaling factor will put more of the load on the booster motor. A value of 1 will set the BoostThrottle equal to the main throttle.

MOT_HOVER_LEARN.Description: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

MOT_PWM_MAX.Description: This sets the max PWM value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors

MOT_PWM_MIN.Description: This sets the min PWM output value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors

MOT_PWM_TYPE.Description: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output

MOT_SAFE_DISARM.Description: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed
MOT_SAFE_DISARM.DisplayName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed
MOT_SAFE_DISARM.Values: 0:PWM enabled while disarmed,1:PWM disabled while disarmed

MOT_SAFE_TIME.Description: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.
MOT_SAFE_TIME.DisplayName: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.

MOT_SLEW_DN_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to slew output from full to zero. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.
MOT_SLEW_DN_TIME.DisplayName: Output slew time for decreasing throttle

MOT_SLEW_UP_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to slew output from zero to full. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.
MOT_SLEW_UP_TIME.DisplayName: Output slew time for increasing throttle

MOT_SPIN_ARM.Description: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

MOT_SPIN_MAX.Description: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

MOT_SPIN_MIN.Description: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

MOT_SPOOL_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

MOT_THST_EXPO.Description: Motor thrust curve exponent (0.0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

MOT_THST_HOVER.Description: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

MOT_YAW_HEADROOM.Description: Yaw control is given at least this pwm in microseconds range

MOT_YAW_SV_ANGLE.Description: Yaw servo's maximum lean angle (Tricopter only)

MSP_OPTIONS.Description: A bitmask to set some MSP specific options

MSP_OSD_NCELLS.Description: Used for average cell voltage calculation

NTF_BUZZ_ON_LVL.Description: Specifies pin level that indicates buzzer should play

NTF_BUZZ_PIN.Description: Enables to connect active buzzer to arbitrary pin. Requires 3-pin buzzer or additional MOSFET! Some the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

NTF_BUZZ_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of Buzzer will be enabled

NTF_BUZZ_VOLUME.Description: Control the volume of the buzzer

NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE.Description: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

NTF_LED_BRIGHT.Description: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

NTF_LED_LEN.Description: The number of Serial LED's to use for notifications (NeoPixel's and ProfiLED)

NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.Description: Specifies the source for the colours and brightness for the LED. OutbackChallenge conforms to the MedicalExpress (https://uavchallenge.org/medical-express/) rules, essentially "Green" is disarmed (safe-to-approach), "Red" is armed (not safe-to-approach). Traffic light is a simplified color set, red when armed, yellow when the safety switch is not surpressing outputs (but disarmed), and green when outputs are surpressed and disarmed, the LED will blink faster if disarmed and failing arming checks.
NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.DisplayName: Specifies colour source for the RGBLed

NTF_LED_TYPES.Bitmask: 0:Built-in LED, 1:Internal ToshibaLED, 2:External ToshibaLED, 3:External PCA9685, 4:Oreo LED, 5:DroneCAN, 6:NCP5623 External, 7:NCP5623 Internal, 8:NeoPixel, 9:ProfiLED, 10:Scripting, 11:DShot, 12:ProfiLED_SPI
NTF_LED_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of LEDs will be enabled

NTF_OREO_THEME.Description: Enable/Disable Solo Oreo LED driver, 0 to disable, 1 for Aircraft theme, 2 for Rover theme

OA_BR_CONT_ANGLE.Description: BendyRuler will resist changing current bearing if the change in bearing is over this angle
OA_BR_CONT_ANGLE.DisplayName: BendyRuler's bearing change resistance threshold angle

OA_BR_CONT_RATIO.Description: BendyRuler will avoid changing bearing unless ratio of previous margin from obstacle (or fence) to present calculated margin is atleast this much.
OA_BR_CONT_RATIO.DisplayName: Obstacle Avoidance margin ratio for BendyRuler to change bearing significantly

OA_BR_LOOKAHEAD.Description: Object Avoidance will look this many meters ahead of vehicle
OA_BR_LOOKAHEAD.DisplayName: Object Avoidance look ahead distance maximum

OA_BR_TYPE.Description: BendyRuler will search for clear path along the direction defined by this parameter

OA_DB_ALT_MIN.Description: OADatabase will reject obstacle's if vehicle's altitude above home is below this parameter, in a 3 meter radius around home. Set 0 to disable this feature.
OA_DB_ALT_MIN.DisplayName: OADatabase minimum altitude above home before storing obstacles

OA_DB_BEAM_WIDTH.Description: Beam width of incoming lidar data

OA_DB_DIST_MAX.Description: Maximum distance of objects held in database. Set to zero to disable the limits

OA_DB_EXPIRE.Description: OADatabase item timeout. The time an item will linger without any updates before it expires. Zero means never expires which is useful for a sent-once static environment but terrible for dynamic ones.

OA_DB_OUTPUT.Description: OADatabase output level to configure which database objects are sent to the ground station. All data is always available internally for avoidance algorithms.
OA_DB_OUTPUT.Values: 0:Disabled,1:Send only HIGH importance items,2:Send HIGH and NORMAL importance items,3:Send all items

OA_DB_QUEUE_SIZE.Description: OADatabase queue maximum number of points. This in an input buffer size. Larger means it can handle larger bursts of incoming data points to filter into the database. No impact on cpu, only RAM. Recommend larger for faster datalinks or for sensors that generate a lot of data.
OA_DB_QUEUE_SIZE.DisplayName: OADatabase queue maximum number of points

OA_DB_RADIUS_MIN.Description: Minimum radius of objects held in database

OA_DB_SIZE.Description: OADatabase maximum number of points. Set to 0 to disable the OA Database. Larger means more points but is more cpu intensive to process

OA_MARGIN_MAX.Description: Object Avoidance will ignore objects more than this many meters from vehicle

OA_OPTIONS.Description: Bitmask which will govern vehicles behaviour while recovering from Obstacle Avoidance (i.e Avoidance is turned off after the path ahead is clear).
OA_OPTIONS.DisplayName: Options while recovering from Object Avoidance

OA_TYPE.DisplayName: Object Avoidance Path Planning algorithm to use

OSD1_ASPD1_EN.Description: Displays airspeed reported directly from primary airspeed sensor

OSD1_ASPD2_EN.Description: Displays airspeed reported directly from secondary airspeed sensor

OSD1_ASPEED_EN.Description: Displays airspeed value being used by TECS (fused value)

OSD1_ATEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by primary airspeed sensor

OSD1_AVGCELLV_EN.Description: Displays average cell voltage. WARNING: this can be inaccurate if the cell count is not detected or set properly. If the the battery is far from fully charged the detected cell count might not be accurate if auto cell count detection is used (OSD_CELL_COUNT=0).

OSD1_BATTBAR_EN.Description: Displays battery usage bar (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_BTEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by secondary barometer

OSD1_CALLSIGN_EN.Description: Displays callsign from callsign.txt on microSD card

OSD1_CELLVOLT_EN.Description: Displays average cell voltage (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_CHAN_MAX.Description: This sets the PWM upper limit for this screen

OSD1_CHAN_MIN.Description: This sets the PWM lower limit for this screen

OSD1_CLK_EN.Description: Displays a clock panel based on AP_RTC local time

OSD1_CRSSHAIR_EN.Description: Displays artificial horizon crosshair (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_CRSSHAIR_X.Description: Horizontal position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_CRSSHAIR_Y.Description: Vertical position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_FENCE_EN.Description: Displays indication of fence enable and breach

OSD1_FONT.Description: Sets the font index for this screen (MSP DisplayPort only)
OSD1_FONT.DisplayName: Sets the font index for this screen (MSP DisplayPort only)

OSD1_HOMEDIR_EN.Description: Displays relative direction to HOME (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_HOMEDIST_EN.Description: Displays distance from HOME (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_HOMEDIST_X.Description: Horizontal position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_HOMEDIST_Y.Description: Vertical position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD1_HOME_EN.Description: Displays distance and relative direction to HOME

OSD1_PITCH_EN.Description: Displays degrees of pitch from level

OSD1_RNGF_EN.Description: Displays a rangefinder's distance in cm

OSD1_ROLL_EN.Description: Displays degrees of roll from level

OSD1_TEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by primary barometer

OSD1_THROTTLE_EN.Description: Displays actual throttle percentage being sent to motor(s)

OSD1_TXT_RES.Description: Sets the overlay text resolution for this screen to either LD 30x16 or HD 50x18 (MSP DisplayPort only)
OSD1_TXT_RES.DisplayName: Sets the overlay text resolution (MSP DisplayPort only)

OSD1_WAYPOINT_EN.Description: Displays bearing and distance to next waypoint

OSD1_WIND_EN.Description: Displays wind speed and relative direction, on Rover this is the apparent wind speed and direction from the windvane, if fitted

OSD2_ASPD1_EN.Description: Displays airspeed reported directly from primary airspeed sensor

OSD2_ASPD2_EN.Description: Displays airspeed reported directly from secondary airspeed sensor

OSD2_ASPEED_EN.Description: Displays airspeed value being used by TECS (fused value)

OSD2_ATEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by primary airspeed sensor

OSD2_AVGCELLV_EN.Description: Displays average cell voltage. WARNING: this can be inaccurate if the cell count is not detected or set properly. If the the battery is far from fully charged the detected cell count might not be accurate if auto cell count detection is used (OSD_CELL_COUNT=0).

OSD2_BATTBAR_EN.Description: Displays battery usage bar (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_BTEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by secondary barometer

OSD2_CALLSIGN_EN.Description: Displays callsign from callsign.txt on microSD card

OSD2_CELLVOLT_EN.Description: Displays average cell voltage (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_CHAN_MAX.Description: This sets the PWM upper limit for this screen

OSD2_CHAN_MIN.Description: This sets the PWM lower limit for this screen

OSD2_CLK_EN.Description: Displays a clock panel based on AP_RTC local time

OSD2_CRSSHAIR_EN.Description: Displays artificial horizon crosshair (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_CRSSHAIR_X.Description: Horizontal position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_CRSSHAIR_Y.Description: Vertical position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_FENCE_EN.Description: Displays indication of fence enable and breach

OSD2_FONT.Description: Sets the font index for this screen (MSP DisplayPort only)
OSD2_FONT.DisplayName: Sets the font index for this screen (MSP DisplayPort only)

OSD2_HOMEDIR_EN.Description: Displays relative direction to HOME (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_HOMEDIST_EN.Description: Displays distance from HOME (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_HOMEDIST_X.Description: Horizontal position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_HOMEDIST_Y.Description: Vertical position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD2_HOME_EN.Description: Displays distance and relative direction to HOME

OSD2_PITCH_EN.Description: Displays degrees of pitch from level

OSD2_RNGF_EN.Description: Displays a rangefinder's distance in cm

OSD2_ROLL_EN.Description: Displays degrees of roll from level

OSD2_TEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by primary barometer

OSD2_THROTTLE_EN.Description: Displays actual throttle percentage being sent to motor(s)

OSD2_TXT_RES.Description: Sets the overlay text resolution for this screen to either LD 30x16 or HD 50x18 (MSP DisplayPort only)
OSD2_TXT_RES.DisplayName: Sets the overlay text resolution (MSP DisplayPort only)

OSD2_WAYPOINT_EN.Description: Displays bearing and distance to next waypoint

OSD2_WIND_EN.Description: Displays wind speed and relative direction, on Rover this is the apparent wind speed and direction from the windvane, if fitted

OSD3_ASPD1_EN.Description: Displays airspeed reported directly from primary airspeed sensor

OSD3_ASPD2_EN.Description: Displays airspeed reported directly from secondary airspeed sensor

OSD3_ASPEED_EN.Description: Displays airspeed value being used by TECS (fused value)

OSD3_ATEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by primary airspeed sensor

OSD3_AVGCELLV_EN.Description: Displays average cell voltage. WARNING: this can be inaccurate if the cell count is not detected or set properly. If the the battery is far from fully charged the detected cell count might not be accurate if auto cell count detection is used (OSD_CELL_COUNT=0).

OSD3_BATTBAR_EN.Description: Displays battery usage bar (MSP OSD only)

OSD3_BTEMP_EN.Description: Displays temperature reported by secondary barometer

OSD3_CALLSIGN_EN.Description: Displays callsign from callsign.txt on microSD card

OSD3_CELLVOLT_EN.Description: Displays average cell voltage (MSP OSD only)

OSD3_CHAN_MAX.Description: This sets the PWM upper limit for this screen

OSD3_CHAN_MIN.Description: This sets the PWM lower limit for this screen

OSD3_CLK_EN.Description: Displays a clock panel based on AP_RTC local time

OSD3_CRSSHAIR_EN.Description: Displays artificial horizon crosshair (MSP OSD only)

OSD3_CRSSHAIR_X.Description: Horizontal position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD3_CRSSHAIR_Y.Description: Vertical position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD3_FENCE_EN.Description: Displays indication of fence enable and breach

OSD3_FONT.Description: Sets the font index for this screen (MSP DisplayPort only)
OSD3_FONT.DisplayName: Sets the font index for this screen (MSP DisplayPort only)

OSD3_HOMEDIR_EN.Description: Displays relative direction to HOME (MSP OSD only)

OSD3_HOMEDIST_EN.Description: Displays distance from HOME (MSP OSD only)

OSD3_HOMEDIST_Y.Description: Vertical position on screen (MSP OSD only)

OSD6_SAVE_X.Description: Horizontal position of Save button on screen

OSD6_SAVE_Y.Description: Vertical position of Save button on screen

OSD_ARM_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on Arm event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_BTN_DELAY.Description: Debounce time in ms for stick commanded parameter navigation.

OSD_CELL_COUNT.Description: Used for average cell voltage display. -1 disables, 0 uses cell count autodetection for well charged LIPO/LIION batteries at connection, other values manually select cell count used.

OSD_CHAN.Description: This sets the channel used to switch different OSD screens.

OSD_DSARM_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on disarm event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_FONT.Description: This sets which OSD font to use. It is an integer from 0 to the number of fonts available

OSD_FS_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on failsafe event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_H_OFFSET.Description: Sets horizontal offset of the osd inside image

OSD_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:UseDecimalPack, 1:InvertedWindPointer, 2:InvertedAHRoll, 3:Convert feet to miles at 5280ft instead of 10000ft, 4:DisableCrosshair
OSD_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options that change the display

OSD_SW_METHOD.Description: This sets the method used to switch different OSD screens.
OSD_SW_METHOD.Values: 0:switch to next screen if channel value was changed,1:select screen based on pwm ranges specified for each screen,2:switch to next screen after low to high transition and every 1s while channel value is high

OSD_TYPE.Description: OSD type. TXONLY makes the OSD parameter selection available to other modules even if there is no native OSD support on the board, for instance CRSF.

OSD_UNITS.Description: Sets the units to use in displaying items

OSD_V_OFFSET.Description: Sets vertical offset of the osd inside image

OSD_W_AVGCELLV.Description: Set level at which AVGCELLV item will flash

OSD_W_BATVOLT.Description: Set level at which BAT_VOLT item will flash

OSD_W_NSAT.Description: Set level at which NSAT item will flash

OSD_W_RESTVOLT.Description: Set level at which RESTVOLT item will flash

OSD_W_RSSI.Description: Set level at which RSSI item will flash

OSD_W_TERR.Description: Set level below which TER_HGT item will flash. -1 disables.

PHLD_BRAKE_ANGLE.Description: PosHold flight mode's max lean angle during braking in centi-degrees

PHLD_BRAKE_RATE.Description: PosHold flight mode's rotation rate during braking in deg/sec

PILOT_ACCEL_Z.Description: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

PILOT_SPEED_DN.Description: The maximum vertical descending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s. If 0 PILOT_SPEED_UP value is used.

PILOT_SPEED_UP.Description: The maximum vertical ascending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

PILOT_THR_BHV.Bitmask: 0:Feedback from mid stick,1:High throttle cancels landing,2:Disarm on land detection
PILOT_THR_BHV.Description: Bitmask containing various throttle stick options. TX with sprung throttle can set PILOT_THR_BHV to "1" so motor feedback when landed starts from mid-stick instead of bottom of stick.
PILOT_THR_BHV.Values: 0:None,1:Feedback from mid stick,2:High throttle cancels landing,4:Disarm on land detection

PILOT_THR_FILT.Description: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

PILOT_TKOFF_ALT.Description: Altitude that altitude control modes will climb to when a takeoff is triggered with the throttle stick.

PILOT_Y_EXPO.Description: Pilot controlled yaw expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

PILOT_Y_RATE.Description: Pilot controlled yaw rate max. Used in all pilot controlled modes except Acro

PILOT_Y_RATE_TC.Description: Pilot yaw rate control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response
PILOT_Y_RATE_TC.DisplayName: Pilot yaw rate control input time constant

PLND_ACC_P_NSE.Description: Kalman Filter Accelerometer Noise, higher values weight the input from the camera more, accels less

PLND_ALT_MAX.Description: Vehicle will continue landing vertically until this height if target is not found. Below this height if landing target is not found, landing retry/failsafe might be attempted. This needs a rangefinder to work. Set to zero to disable this.

PLND_ALT_MIN.Description: Vehicle will continue landing vertically even if target is lost below this height. This needs a rangefinder to work. Set to zero to disable this.

PLND_BUS.Description: Precland sensor bus for I2C sensors.

PLND_CAM_POS_X.Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

PLND_CAM_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

PLND_CAM_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

PLND_EST_TYPE.Description: Specifies the estimation method to be used

PLND_LAG.Description: Precision Landing sensor lag, to cope with variable landing_target latency

PLND_LAND_OFS_X.Description: Desired landing position of the camera forward of the target in vehicle body frame

PLND_LAND_OFS_Y.Description: desired landing position of the camera right of the target in vehicle body frame

PLND_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0: Moving Landing Target, 1: Allow Precision Landing after manual reposition

PLND_RET_BEHAVE.Description: Prec Land will do the action selected by this parameter if a retry to a landing is needed
PLND_RET_BEHAVE.Values: 0:Go to the last location where landing target was detected,1:Go towards the approximate location of the detected landing target

PLND_RET_MAX.Description: PrecLand Maximum number of retires for a failed landing. Set to zero to disable landing retry.
PLND_RET_MAX.DisplayName: PrecLand Maximum number of retires for a failed landing

PLND_STRICT.Description: How strictly should the vehicle land on the target if target is lost
PLND_STRICT.Values: 0:Land Vertically (Not strict),1:Retry Landing(Normal Strictness),2:Do not land (just Hover) (Very Strict)

PLND_TIMEOUT.Description: Time for which vehicle continues descend even if target is lost. After this time period, vehicle will attemp a landing retry depending on PLND_STRICT parameter.

PLND_XY_DIST_MAX.Description: The vehicle will not start descending if the landing target is detected and it is further than this many meters away. Set 0 to always descend.
PLND_XY_DIST_MAX.DisplayName: Precision Landing maximum distance to target before descending

PLND_YAW_ALIGN.Description: Yaw angle from body x-axis to sensor x-axis.

PRX1_MAX.Description: Maximum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX1_MIN.Description: Minimum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX1_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PRX2_MAX.Description: Maximum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX2_MIN.Description: Minimum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX2_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PRX3_MAX.Description: Maximum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX3_MIN.Description: Minimum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX3_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PRX4_MAX.Description: Maximum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX4_MIN.Description: Minimum expected range for Proximity Sensor. Setting this to 0 will set value to manufacturer reported range.

PRX4_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PRX_FILT.Description: Cutoff frequency for low pass filter applied to each face in the proximity boundary

PRX_IGN_GND.Description: Ignore proximity data that is within 1 meter of the ground below the vehicle. This requires a downward facing rangefinder

PRX_LOG_RAW.Description: Set this parameter to one if logging unfiltered(raw) distances from sensor should be enabled

PSC_ACCZ_D.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

PSC_ACCZ_FLTD.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz
PSC_ACCZ_FLTD.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz

PSC_ACCZ_FLTE.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz
PSC_ACCZ_FLTE.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz

PSC_ACCZ_FLTT.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz
PSC_ACCZ_FLTT.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz

PSC_ACCZ_I.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

PSC_ACCZ_IMAX.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

PSC_ACCZ_P.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

PSC_ACCZ_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

PSC_ACC_XY_FILT.Description: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

PSC_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle autopilot can request. Set to zero to use ANGLE_MAX parameter value

PSC_JERK_XY.Description: Jerk limit of the horizontal kinematic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target
PSC_JERK_XY.DisplayName: Jerk limit for the horizontal kinematic input shaping

PSC_JERK_Z.Description: Jerk limit of the vertical kinematic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target
PSC_JERK_Z.DisplayName: Jerk limit for the vertical kinematic input shaping

PSC_POSXY_P.Description: Position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

PSC_POSZ_P.Description: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

PSC_VELXY_D.Description: Velocity (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

PSC_VELXY_FF.Description: Velocity (horizontal) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

PSC_VELXY_FLTD.Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

PSC_VELXY_FLTE.Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

PSC_VELXY_I.Description: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

PSC_VELXY_IMAX.Description: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

PSC_VELXY_P.Description: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

PSC_VELZ_D.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

PSC_VELZ_FF.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller Feed Forward gain. Produces an output that is proportional to the magnitude of the target

PSC_VELZ_FLTD.Description: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D terms
PSC_VELZ_FLTD.DisplayName: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term

PSC_VELZ_FLTE.Description: Velocity (vertical) error filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

PSC_VELZ_I.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

PSC_VELZ_IMAX.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

PSC_VELZ_P.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

RALLY_INCL_HOME.Description: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL

RALLY_LIMIT_KM.Description: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

RALLY_TOTAL.Description: Number of rally points currently loaded

RC10_DZ.Description: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

RC10_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC10_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RCMAP_PITCH.Description: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_ROLL.Description: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_THROTTLE.Description: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_YAW.Description: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RC_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Ignore RC Receiver, 1:Ignore MAVLink Overrides, 2:Ignore Receiver Failsafe bit but allow other RC failsafes if setup, 3:FPort Pad, 4:Log RC input bytes, 5:Arming check throttle for 0 input, 6:Skip the arming check for neutral Roll/Pitch/Yaw sticks, 7:Allow Switch reverse, 8:Use passthrough for CRSF telemetry, 9:Suppress CRSF mode/rate message for ELRS systems,10:Enable multiple receiver support, 11:Use Link Quality for RSSI with CRSF, 13: Use 420kbaud for ELRS protocol

RC_OVERRIDE_TIME.Description: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

RC_PROTOCOLS.Description: Bitmask of enabled RC protocols. Allows narrowing the protocol detection to only specific types of RC receivers which can avoid issues with incorrect detection. Set to 1 to enable all protocols.

RC_SPEED.Description: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

RELAY_DEFAULT.Description: The state of the relay on boot.

RELAY_PIN.Description: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera shutter control. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.
RELAY_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5,27:BBBMini Pin P8.17,101:MainOut1,102:MainOut2,103:MainOut3,104:MainOut4,105:MainOut5,106:MainOut6,107:MainOut7,108:MainOut8

RELAY_PIN2.Description: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.
RELAY_PIN2.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5,65:BBBMini Pin P8.18,101:MainOut1,102:MainOut2,103:MainOut3,104:MainOut4,105:MainOut5,106:MainOut6,107:MainOut7,108:MainOut8

RNGFND1_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND1_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND1_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND1_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V. For PWM input, the pin must be configured as a digital GPIO, see the Wiki's "GPIOs" section for details.

RNGFND1_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND1_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND1_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND1_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

RNGFND1_SNR_MIN.Description: Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

RNGFND1_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.
RNGFND1_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:AUX1,51:AUX2,52:AUX3,53:AUX4,54:AUX5,55:AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFND1_WSP_AVG.Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

RNGFND1_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND1_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND1_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND1_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND2_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND2_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. RNGFND7_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND7_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND7_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND7_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND7_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V. For PWM input, the pin must be configured as a digital GPIO, see the Wiki's "GPIOs" section for details.

RNGFND7_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND7_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND7_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND7_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND7_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND7_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND7_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

RNGFND7_SNR_MIN.Description: Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

RNGFND7_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.
RNGFND7_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:AUX1,51:AUX2,52:AUX3,53:AUX4,54:AUX5,55:AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFND7_WSP_AVG.Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

RNGFND7_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND7_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND7_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND7_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND8_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND8_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.
RNGFNDA_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:AUX1,51:AUX2,52:AUX3,53:AUX4,54:AUX5,55:AUX6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFNDA_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFNDA_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFNDA_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND_FILT.Description: Rangefinder filter to smooth distance. Set to zero to disable filtering

RPM1_ESC_MASK.Description: Mask of channels which support ESC rpm telemetry. RPM telemetry of the selected channels will be averaged
RPM1_ESC_MASK.DisplayName: Bitmask of ESC telemetry channels to average

RPM1_MAX.Description: Maximum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

RPM1_MIN.Description: Minimum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

RPM1_MIN_QUAL.Description: Minimum data quality to be used

RPM1_PIN.Description: Which digital GPIO pin to use. Only used on type = GPIO. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RPM1_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM1_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RPM2_ESC_MASK.Description: Mask of channels which support ESC rpm telemetry. RPM telemetry of the selected channels will be averaged
RPM2_ESC_MASK.DisplayName: Bitmask of ESC telemetry channels to average

RPM2_MAX.Description: Maximum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

RPM2_MIN.Description: Minimum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

RPM2_MIN_QUAL.Description: Minimum data quality to be used

RPM2_PIN.Description: Which digital GPIO pin to use. Only used on type = GPIO. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RPM2_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM2_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RSSI_ANA_PIN.Description: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

RSSI_CHANNEL.Description: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

RSSI_CHAN_HIGH.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

RSSI_CHAN_LOW.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

RSSI_PIN_HIGH.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

RSSI_PIN_LOW.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

RSSI_TYPE.Description: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

RTL_ALT.Description: The minimum alt above home the vehicle will climb to before returning. If the vehicle is flying higher than this value it will return at its current altitude.

RTL_ALT_FINAL.Description: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to zero to land.

RTL_ALT_TYPE.Description: RTL altitude type. Set to 1 for Terrain following during RTL and then set WPNAV_RFND_USE=1 to use rangefinder or WPNAV_RFND_USE=0 to use Terrain database

RTL_CLIMB_MIN.Description: The vehicle will climb this many cm during the initial climb portion of the RTL

RTL_CONE_SLOPE.Description: Defines a cone above home which determines maximum climb

RTL_LOIT_TIME.Description: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before beginning final descent

RTL_OPTIONS.Description: Options that can be applied to change RTL mode behaviour

RTL_SPEED.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally while flying home. If this is set to zero, WPNAV_SPEED will be used instead.

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

SCHED_LOOP_RATE.Description: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

SCHED_OPTIONS.Description: This controls optional aspects of the scheduler.

SCR_DEBUG_OPTS.Bitmask: 0:No Scripts to run message if all scripts have stopped, 1:Runtime messages for memory usage and execution time, 2:Suppress logging scripts to dataflash, 3:log runtime memory usage and execution time, 4:Disable pre-arm check

SCR_DIR_DISABLE.Description: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

SCR_HEAP_SIZE.Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

SCR_USER1.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER2.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER3.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER4.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER5.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER6.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_VM_I_COUNT.Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate
SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None,1:MAVLink1,2:MAVLink2,3:Frsky D,4:Frsky SPort,5:GPS,7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial,8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial,9:Rangefinder,10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX),11:Lidar360,13:Beacon,14:Volz servo out,15:SBus servo out,16:ESC Telemetry,17:Devo Telemetry,18:OpticalFlow,19:RobotisServo,20:NMEA Output,21:WindVane,22:SLCAN,23:RCIN,24:EFI Serial,25:LTM,26:RunCam,27:HottTelem,28:Scripting,29:Crossfire VTX,30:Generator,31:Winch,32:MSP,33:DJI FPV,34:AirSpeed,35:ADSB,36:AHRS,37:SmartAudio,38:FETtecOneWire,39:Torqeedo,40:AIS,41:CoDevESC,42:DisplayPort,43:MAVLink High Latency,44:IRC Tramp

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate
SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL3_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate
SERIAL3_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERIAL4_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used for Serial4. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL4_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate
SERIAL4_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERIAL4_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol Serial4 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL_PASS1.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASS2.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASSTIMO.Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

SERVO10_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO10_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO10_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO31_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO31_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO31_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO31_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.
